publicwhip.spmotion: * S2M-2408# Donald Gorrie:Suicides by Older People in Scotland—That the Parliament is concerned at the statistics about suicides by older people in Scotland, especially older men; believes that more attention needs to be given to treating depression in general and, especially, among older people, persuading older men suffering from depression to discuss their problems with their GP and improving the performance of the primary care system in recognising the symptoms of depression and treating it more rapidly, and considers that the relevant authorities should undertake more research into the causes of depression and suicide and should add older people as a priority group to the other seven priority groups focused on in Choose Life, the national strategy to prevent suicide. Supported by: Iain Smith*, Mike Pringle*, Robert Brown*, John Farquhar Munro*, Margaret Smith*, Jeremy Purvis*, George Lyon*, Nora Radcliffe*

S2M-2408 # Donald Gorrie:Suicides by Older People in Scotland—That the Parliament is concerned at the statistics about suicides by older people in Scotland, especially older men; believes that more attention needs to be given to treating depression in general and, especially, among older people, persuading older men suffering from depression to discuss their problems with their GP and improving the performance of the primary care system in recognising the symptoms of depression and treating it more rapidly, and considers that the relevant authorities should undertake more research into the causes of depression and suicide and should add older people as a priority group to the other seven priority groups focused on in Choose Life, the national strategy to prevent suicide. Supported by: Iain Smith, Mike Pringle, Robert Brown, John Farquhar Munro, Margaret Smith, Jeremy Purvis, George Lyon, Nora Radcliffe, Ms Sandra White*
